intro: Sphaerostephanos veitchii, commonly known as the Veitch's sphaerostephanos, is a rare and striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its unique, spherical flower heads that resemble small umbels, giving it a distinctive appearance. Native to the mountainous regions of southern China, this plant thrives in cool, moist environments. Its foliage consists of finely divided, aromatic leaves that emit a subtle fragrance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
